The following URL takes you to the Essay iitself,
 (An intro Not is below)
 
 http://www.truthtree.com/atheism/whynot.shtml
 
 -------------------
 Possible Questions for anyone that will read the Essay at the above.
 -------------------
 1)What parts of this essay do you feel presented his weakest arguments?
 
 2) What parts of this essay do you feel presented his strongest arguments?
 
 3) Was there anything of value to you, in this essay?
 
 
 "Why I Am Not A Christtian" by Bertrand Russell
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------Introductory note: Russell delivered this lecture on March 6, 1927 to the National Secular Society, South London Branch, at Battersea Town Hall. Published in pamphlet form in that same year, the essay subsequently achieved new fame with Paul Edwards' edition of Russell's book, Why I Am Not a Christian and Other Essays ... (1957).

post_info.post_title: Why I Am Not A Christianb y Bertrand Russell

Bertrand Russell's daughter said of him in My Father, Bertrand Russell, "I believe myself that his whole life was a search for God, or, for those who prefer less personal terms, for absolute certainty." For more on this see the thread Atheists and their Fathers.

Bertrand Russell's daughter said of him in My Father, Bertrand Russell, "I believe myself that his whole life was a search for God, or, for those who prefer less personal terms, for absolute certainty." For more on this see the thread Atheists and their Fathers.

 
 As an Atheist, I found his B.R.'s essay rather unimpressive. Personally, I would have come up with an essay about all religions, as opposed to a single one. Even so, I found his essay lacking more persuasive reasons he could have made.

 Yes, treat, I found it unimpressive also (as a Christian). I read it at some point during a time when I was inquisitive...a time of some questioning of my Christian beliefs but mostly just of seeing what was out there and how it stacked up against my beliefs. I have the book with some of his other writings around here. I remember writing some notes in it but I don't have it handy at the moment. If I find it and any of my notes seem worthwhile then I will post again.
